snippet: The budget resolution for 2015 will probably get full support from House Republicans, but voters should look closely at the details.
abstract: Editorial contends Republican budget for 2015 released by Rep Paul Ryan is a document designed solely so that House Republicans can have something to show their most antigovernment voters in advance of midterm elections; criticizes details of the budget, and warns that Ryan could be very dangerous if he ends up securing chairmanship of the Ways and Means Committee.
lead_paragraph: The budget resolution for 2015 will probably get full support from House Republicans, but voters should look closely at the details.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: House Committee on Ways and Means
